H0.text: Red light has the longest wavelength.

H1.text: Green light has the longest wavelength.

H2.text: Violet light has the longest wavelength.

H3.text: Yellow light has the longest wavelength.

A4.text: The visible band sits adjacent to the infrared (with longer wavelengths and lower frequencies)

A5.text: Deep red light has a wavelength of roughly 700 nm.

A6.text: Violet light has a wavelength of about 400 nm.

A7.text: Red is the color at the long wavelength end of the visible spectrum of light, next to orange and opposite violet.

A8.text: Colors with a shorter wavelength, such as blue and green, scatter more strongly, and are removed from the light that finally reaches the eye.
